definition: to get on a horse/to mount
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: Cao Xiu donned his armor and rode into the city with 1, 000 men to stop the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 休急披挂上马，引千余人在城中拒敌。

sentences.english: Lift him on the horse, Scarlett, and face his head toward its tail.
sentences.chinese: 史考烈特，将他抬上马，头面对着尾巴。

sentences.english: He jumped onto the horse and galloped in the direction of the temple .
sentences.chinese: 他跳上马，朝寺庙方向飞奔而去。

sentences.english: He caught a kelpie, and tied her behind him on his horse.
sentences.chinese: 他抓来一只水精，把她拉上马，绑在自己的身后。

sentences.english: The project will start next year.
He saddled the horse and rode off with all speed.
sentences.chinese: 他给马套上鞍子，骑上马全速奔去。

sentences.english: Harry rode on a horse to purse him.
Miss Chenery, I risk my life every time I climb on a horse.
sentences.chinese: 切纳利蜜斯，每次我一上马就是在拿我的生命冒险。

sentences.english: Three Gorges Project is the inevitable result of lacking transparency in policies and media.
sentences.chinese: 三峡工程上马是政策不透明，媒体不开放的必然产物。

sentences.english: They jumped on to their horses and dashed away.
Top with the mozzarella cheese and the remaining Parmesan cheese.
sentences.chinese: 表面撒上马苏里拉奶酪和帕尔玛干酪。

sentences.english: Every night he rises from his burial place, jumps on his horse and rides through the valley looking for his lost head.
sentences.chinese: 每晚他都从坟墓中走出来，骑上马去寻找他的头颅。

sentences.english: Under such a circumstance I would give a flat denial, and ride off as fast as I could.
sentences.chinese: 遇到这种事，我会爽爽快快地谢绝，骑上马就走。

sentences.english: Then we got on some horses, and rode away through the night.
sentences.chinese: 于是我们骑上马，连夜骑马离开。

sentences.english: Mum asked all the riders to mount up and follow Emily.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈告诉所有的骑士骑上马跟着艾米莉。

sentences.english: In 2003 Wu Han iron & steel company constructs the Entity Producing & Selling Information System.
sentences.chinese: 2003年武钢上马了整体产销资讯系统。

definition: to dismount from a horse/(fig.) to abandon (a project)
horse's head/same as 碼頭|码头[ma3 tou2], pier
to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
to mount (a horse, bike, flight of stairs, rickshaw etc)
to whip on/to raise a whip/by ext. to swagger
horseback
to urge on a horse by patting its bottom/fig. to encourage/same as 拍馬屁|拍马屁, to flatter or toady
to spur the horse to full speed (idiom)/to go as fast as possible
to guide a horse with the reins/to rein in a horse
warhorse
Malaya/Malaysia
to turn/to turn around/to transfer (funds etc)
to turn over (when lying)/(fig.) to free oneself/to emancipate oneself/to bring about a change of one's fortunes
to gallop/to spur on a horse/to let one's steed have his head
saddle
reins
